title: Lessons in Reproducibility: Insights from NLP Studies in Materials Science. (arXiv:2307.15759v1 [physics.chem-ph])
abstract: Natural Language Processing (NLP), a cornerstone field within artificial intelligence, has been increasingly utilized in the field of materials science literature. Our study conducts a reproducibility analysis of two pioneering works within this domain: "Machine-learned and codified synthesis parameters of oxide materials" by Kim et al., and "Unsupervised word embeddings capture latent knowledge from materials science literature" by Tshitoyan et al. We aim to comprehend these studies from a reproducibility perspective, acknowledging their significant influence on the field of materials informatics, rather than critiquing them. Our study indicates that both papers offered thorough workflows, tidy and well-documented codebases, and clear guidance for model evaluation. This makes it easier to replicate their results successfully and partially reproduce their findings. In doing so, they set commendable standards for future materials science publications to aspire to. However, our analysis

Title: Lessons in Reproducibility: Insights from NLP Studies in Materials Science. (arXiv:2307.15759v1 [physics.chem-ph])
Abstract: Natural Language Processing (NLP), a cornerstone field within artificial intelligence, has been increasingly utilized in the field of materials science literature. Our study conducts a reproducibility analysis of two pioneering works within this domain: "Machine-learned and codified synthesis parameters of oxide materials" by Kim et al., and "Unsupervised word embeddings capture latent knowledge from materials science literature" by Tshitoyan et al. We aim to comprehend these studies from a reproducibility perspective, acknowledging their significant influence on the field of materials informatics, rather than critiquing them. Our study indicates that both papers offered thorough workflows, tidy and well-documented codebases, and clear guidance for model evaluation. This makes it easier to replicate their results successfully and partially reproduce their findings. In doing so, they set commendable standards for future materials science publications to aspire to. However, our analysis
translated_title: 可再现性探究：从材料科学中的NLP研究中获得的见解
translated_abstract: 自然语言处理（NLP）作为人工智能中的基石领域，越来越多地被应用于材料科学文献领域。本研究对该领域中的两项开创性研究：“机器学习和编码的氧化物材料合成参数”（Kim等人）和“无监督的词嵌入从材料科学文献中提取潜在知识”（Tshitoyan等人）进行了可再现性分析。我们的研究旨在从可再现性的角度理解这些研究，认识到它们对材料信息学领域的重要影响，而不是批评它们。我们的研究表明，这两篇论文提供了详尽的工作流程、整洁且有良好文档的代码库，以及清晰的模型评估指导。这使得成功复制他们的结果并部分重现他们的发现变得更加容易。通过这样做，它们为未来的材料科学出版物树立了值得称赞的标准。
tldr: 这两篇论文对于材料科学领域的NLP研究提供了重要的可再现性分析，其中包括了详尽的工作流程、整洁的代码库和清晰的模型评估指导，为未来的材料科学出版物树立了良好的标准。
en_tdlr: These two papers provide important reproducibility analysis for NLP studies in the field of materials science, including thorough workflows, tidy codebases, and clear model evaluation guidance, setting commendable standards for future materials science publications.
